trans-unit.source: A trigger action that provides functionality for seeking (skipping) to a specified time within the active period of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard"></xref>.

Use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard> action with an <xref:System.Windows.EventTrigger> or a <xref:System.Windows.Trigger> to seek a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard>.

Note that seek operations do not take the storyboard's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ParallelTimeline.SlipBehavior%2A> settings into account: the storyboard is treated as though it had a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio%2A> of 1 and no <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ParallelTimeline.SlipBehavior%2A>.

Seeking a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> triggers its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.CurrentGlobalSpeedInvalidated> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.CurrentStateInvalidated> events.
Pause, Resume, Stop, or Otherwise Control a Storyboard Interactively

To be able to pause, resume, or otherwise control a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> interactively, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> property of its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> and use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ControllableStoryboardAction> object (such as <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.PauseStoryboard>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ResumeStoryboard>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.StopStoryboard>) to control it by referencing its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> is unspecified, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> cannot be interactively controlled after it is begun.

See [How to: Use Event Triggers to Control a Storyboard After It Starts](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/how-to-use-event-triggers-to-control-a-storyboard-after-it-starts.md) for more information.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the amount by which the storyboard should move forward or backward from the seek origin <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Origin"></xref>.

Note that seek operations do not take the storyboard's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ParallelTimeline.SlipBehavior%2A> settings into account: the storyboard is treated as though it had a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio%2A> of 1 and no <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ParallelTimeline.SlipBehavior%2A>.
XAML Attribute Usage
\<*object* <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Offset%2A>="[-][*days*.]*hours*:*minutes*:*seconds*[.*fractionalSeconds*]"/>
\- or -
\<*object* <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Offset%2A>="[-][*days*.]*hours*:*minutes*"/>
\- or -
\<*object* <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Offset%2A>="[-]*days*"/>
XAML Values
Items in square brackets (`[` and `]`) are optional.
*days*
A value greater than or equal to 0 that describes the number of days spanned by this offset.
*hours*
A value between 0 and 23 that represents the number of hours spanned by this offset.
*minutes*
A value between 0 and 59 that represents the number of minutes spanned by this offset.
*seconds*
A value between 0 and 59 that represents the number of seconds spanned by this offset.
*fractionalSeconds*
A value consisting of 1 to 7 digits that represents fractional seconds.
For the complete <xref:System.TimeSpan> syntax, see the Remarks section of the <xref:System.TimeSpan.Parse%2A> page.

A positive or negative value that specifies the amount by which the storyboard should move forward or backward from the seek origin <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Origin"></xref>.
The default value is 0.
Gets or sets the position from which this seek operation's <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Offset"></xref> is applied.
The position from which this seek operation's <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Offset"></xref> is applied.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.TimeSeekOrigin.BeginTime"></xref>.

Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Offset"></xref> property of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard"></xref> should be serialized.

**true** if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Offset"></xref> property of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard"></xref> should be serialized; otherwise, **false**.
